TopicTitle: KSP Weekly: Longest Stay on the Moon

Articles.Content:
1 hour ago, Deddly said:

Graphics are important to some people, and then some people are happy with Minecraft's default graphics. We need to accept that not everyone has the same priorities.

Graphics are important to some people but not to us.

Mine craft despite its limits it consistent kerbal could have been in ascii for all I care as long as it was consistent. Kerbal now is not consistent and those old rockomax tanks are a prime example. will you please stop trying to deflect and discredit us by trying to make it sound like this is about the old pc "moar gphx!" Stereotype 

 

Edited December 12, 2017 by passinglurker

1 hour ago, Deddly said:

Graphics are important to some people, and then some people are happy with Minecraft's default graphics. We need to accept that not everyone has the same priorities.

Minecraft has a consistent aesthetic that is actually appealing in it's own way.  Simple art doesn't mean bad art.

1 hour ago, tater said:

Pick an aesthetic. Is KSP repurposed junkyard parts or not, it needs to be one or the other.

I'm not disagreeing with you entirely. IF I had a stock option for better looking 2.5m tanks I would surely use them - though I find using orange comfortable. In my own game playing style it is the much loved, by others, plane parts that don't match the random style of everything else. I very seldom use the plane parts so their appeal is lost on me. I do use the overhaul stock parts released by Squad. I find most (not all) of them pretty cool looking. I would like it if the 2.5m tanks looked more like a mix between the overhaul and NASA parts. 

Looking at what Squad is slowly leaking to us, I presume we will soon have newer more closely matching parts. Some of us may be less than thrilled with the chosen aesthetic but an update is long overdo and welcome.

3 hours ago, tater said:

Is there a single person who thinks the smallest three of the 2.5m tanks are anything but awful looking?

I could not care less

You're operating with hindsight. Which is always 20/20. The folk who had a mess to clean up a year ago and had to get it right the first time didn't have that advantage, so they played it safe. 

I think you have me mistaken for someone else I created my account this month and are you accusing me of lying?

Also what was the first time?

How exactly would you like me to cite a private conversation in a private message between me and a SQUAD Member

You had indeed previously claimed to have been told dubious major scoops by SQUAD, and the proof is there for all to see in the post I cited. Then you said:

1 hour ago, Cheif Operations Director said:

I think you have me mistaken for someone else I created my account this month and are you accusing me of lying?

Also what was the first time?

Effectively denying you ever said it.

This is a pattern of behavior most of us remember from when we were much, much younger: there was that kid at school who wanted attention and to impress his classmates, and resorted to inventing tall tales to do it, often claiming secret knowledge based on sources only he could access. Please understand that this will not work on a forum where your previous statements can be searched and cited on demand, and where your supposed secret sources of knowledge have a well established track record of discretion. As you stated earlier, you joined the forum this month, so the idea that a SQUAD staff member would randomly private message you confidential business and technical information is beyond absurd.

On 12/8/2017 at 4:49 PM, SQUAD said:

In other news, KSP on Consoles is ever closer to its release and this means that the focus is shifting towards polishing details and attempting to find any remaining issues. In the meantime, we are pleased to announce that the official name of these versions is Kerbal Space Program Enhanced Edition! And if you’ve been paying attention you’ll know that we are not only including a reworked UI, 3 different Controller Set Ups exclusive to consoles, and a wide array of improvements, but also all the content included in 1.2.2 Loud and Clear. We’ll be posting more detailed information about these ports in the upcoming weeks, so stick around for that.

No such announcement? Really?

also no one changes the name of their game that much for an update. 

They called it loud and clear and enhanced so loud and clear is the undate name and ehanced is the game name so somehow I'm wrong?

I've asked how you want me to cite a private message

Edited December 12, 2017 by Cheif Operations Director

6 minutes ago, Cheif Operations Director said:

No such announcement? Really?

You said that a SQUAD staff member told you that data would be lost with the console update (emphasis mine):

On 12/2/2017 at 9:46 PM, Cheif Operations Director said:

Hate to Destoy your optimism but data is lost with this update a member of squad told me in a message

You claim as support this post:

On 12/8/2017 at 3:49 PM, SQUAD said:
In other news, KSP on Consoles is ever closer to its release and this means that the focus is shifting towards polishing details and attempting to find any remaining issues. In the meantime, we are pleased to announce that the official name of these versions is Kerbal Space Program Enhanced Edition! And if you’ve been paying attention you’ll know that we are not only including a reworked UI, 3 different Controller Set Ups exclusive to consoles, and a wide array of improvements, but also all the content included in 1.2.2 Loud and Clear. We’ll be posting more detailed information about these ports in the upcoming weeks, so stick around for that.

This says nothing whatsoever about data being lost. So yes, no such announcement has been made, as I said.

Ahh Kerbal Space Program Enhanced edition is a new game! How do you expect data to be transferable from a incompatable game. Their code isn't the same it wasn't designed or be transferable!

Squad confirming they care for a community and speaking about a specific part like the sentinel Telescope coming to the game and mentioning something that was pretty much made clear just without actually saying it isn't some super secret as you are trying to portray me as a kindergartner.

Me private messaging a Squad Member because the main ones were not answering because they were too busy which is fine and the chance he replies to my question throughly with a fact that was being released in less than a week isn't a kindergarten fantasy tail!

It not like I Asked about 1.4 or 1.5 Inasked about something that is begin released in a month and the announcement in less than a week

Just now, Cheif Operations Director said:

Ahh Kerbal Space Program Enhanced edition is a new game! How do you expect data to be transferable from a incompatable game.

Those are guesses and assumptions and leaps of logic on your part, not statements by SQUAD. Frankly, if your reaction to the announcement of the name of a console update is "it's going to be incompatible and data will be lost," then I find your stories about SQUAD's secret statements to you even less plausible than I did before this exchange.

7 minutes ago, Cheif Operations Director said:

Ahh Kerbal Space Program Enhanced edition is a new game! How do you expect data to be transferable from a incompatable game. Their code isn't the same it wasn't designed or be transferable!

They probably didn't rewrite the saving module. That would require rewriting all the part configs, because they use the same components (namely ConfigNode). The saves are plain text files and there's no reason to change the way in which they are saved or loaded.

3 minutes ago, Cheif Operations Director said:

And what motive would I have for lying you think I want to lose my space station on console?

Your motives are your own business. So far we have from you:

  • That you did not previously claim secret leaks from SQUAD (this has been proven false)
  • That SQUAD confirmed that the console update would be save-breaking (this has been proven false)
3 minutes ago, Cheif Operations Director said:

How do you know what I said is false you can't prove im lying 

Lying isn't the only way to make false statements. It can also happen if the speaker misunderstands or misremembers the facts. I suspect there's a healthy mix of that here. Also note the inclusion of "misleading or unsupported." Not all of your statements so far are provably false (yet); the others may only be misleading or unsupported. For example, it might conceivably be the case that the console update breaks saves, but since we have no reason to believe that yet, and good reasons not to believe it given by @0111narwhalz, that claim of yours is unsupported, and your suggestion that it is supported is misleading.

3 minutes ago, Cheif Operations Director said:

I can't quote yet but when I figure it out I'll let you know, or when I'm prove right

You could try asking the SQUAD staff member(s) for permission to share their private messages, and then post them, with attribution. That way everyone could see exactly what was said and make their own interpretations.

I asked them permission and am pending a response and they are not "secret leaks"'They were answers to a question that would be answered anyways in less than a week. @SQUAD I am ultra hyped to see the mission builder and what all the great modders make of it.  I was wondering if there was any information about the possibility linking multiple missions together into a campaign as asked by @HebaruSan some weeks ago.

30 minutes ago, James Kerman said:

@SQUAD I am ultra hyped to see the mission builder and what all the great modders make of it.  I was wondering if there was any information about the possibility linking multiple missions together into a campaign as asked by @HebaruSan some weeks ago.

I've been thinking about this as well. If a creator is willing to put in the work, it sounds like you could do just about anything with these missions. If they really can be strung together, I think you'll be hearing a lot of "hey, you gotta try so-and-so's campaign; it's awesome". I'm really hoping it's true, cuz I'm already looking forward to it.

2 hours ago, 0111narwhalz said:

They probably didn't rewrite the saving module. That would require rewriting all the part configs, because they use the same components (namely ConfigNode). The saves are plain text files and there's no reason to change the way in which they are saved or loaded.

 

2 hours ago, HebaruSan said:

and good reasons not to believe it given by @0111narwhalz

I'm not taking part in this discussion about private statements, but I do want to point out that saving and loading saves is one of the most, if not the most, severe problems of the existing console versions. I'm quite sure that the save/load system was rewritten from scratch along with everything else.

I would not be surprised if current save files would not be compatible with the re-released console versions. That being said, I'm sure if Squad/Blitworks could find a way to keep compatibility they would do it. Obviously, lacking an official statement means anything is possible, but my money is on saves being incompatible.

 

That actually brings up a relevent question: Has anyone ever ripped a console version save file? Are they just plain-text like a PC version save file? Sometimes save files are encrypted to prevent users from tampering with them.

Edited December 13, 2017 by Mako
Thanks
